name: places/ChIJF3oEkAlZwokRsJgU6l0AX9g
formattedAddress: 215 E 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 215 E 26th St, New York, NY 10010, USA

originalText.text: I've had good experiences coming here with my Pekingese. The Asian man (unsure of his name) is friendly and always does a great job - I would say Nino gets one of better cuts he's had from him. I'm unsure how competitive the pricing is - I've only taken Nino here as well as the Unleashed Spa in the East Village, and those two places are priced similarly - but I've always been happy and intend to continue to bring my pup here as it's closer to my house than Unleashed, and he always gets the same groomer which is a bonus. EDIT: took a star off as my dog's rear paws appear irritated. He is chewing them obsessively for the fourth day now. Unsure what happened, seems they really irritated him with the clippers. Will have to take him to the vet.

originalText.text: Love Downtown Doghouse! Veronica who grooms our mini schnauzer is so good we travel from Brooklyn to have her groom him. Booking appointments is very easy over text and payment is always easy and safe. Always attentive to our grooming requests and Alfie always looks great and is very happy after his appointment.

text.text: Love Downtown Doghouse! Veronica who grooms our mini schnauzer is so good we travel from Brooklyn to have her groom him. Booking appointments is very easy over text and payment is always easy and safe. Always attentive to our grooming requests and Alfie always looks great and is very happy after his appointment.

originalText.text:
This place has bad business practices and is a rip off. They quote my dog as small and say it will cost $110, I agree and use them for a grooming. My dog is only 24 lbs, qualified as small by petco and any small dog park, pet insurance etc but after grooming they say my dog is actually medium sized thus I need to pay $160 instead of $110 over the phone to their operator. On top of that, they don't include nail trimming or toothbrushing, each of those is $10 additional. And then they ask me to pay with credit card when I had cash then they without telling me charge me $9 credit card fee but they won't accept my cash, only a check which I didn't have to avoid the fee. So after tip, fees, $10 toothbrushing etc I'm charged around $220 when I thought It'd be like $150 max which is already overpriced for a small dog grooming.

Why would anyone go here over petco or petsmart which includes so much more and is only like $90 for same service. Complete rip off. The actual grooming was ok nothing special. You got to disclose credit card service charge and dog size cost before not after as a surprise. I'm never going back.

Why would anyone go here over petco or petsmart which includes so much more and is only like $90 for same service. Complete rip off. The actual grooming was ok nothing special. You got to disclose credit card service charge and dog size cost before not after as a surprise. I'm never going back.

originalText.text: Our labradoodle Hudson has gone to Veronica a few times and she does the best job! He gets very excited to see her and it’s evident she really cares about him/his well-being. Back in February, Hudson was very matted from the snow and rain and we were left with no (ethical) choice but to shave him pretty short. I was sad at first as we loved all his fluff, but in the end it was the right decision. Now it’s growing back in nicely and Veronica’s cuts will help us maintain his beautiful coat moving forward! Easy scheduling and they text you when your pup is ready. There are many groomers but I can assure you that many don’t care about your dog in the way Downtown Doghouse does. They listen to what you want too and will work with you so there are no surprises! Plus, it’s great to have the same groomer each time so your dog gets accustomed to him/her.

originalText.text: My six year old Bichon was accused of trying to bite the groomer and the groomer claimed that she didn’t feel safe finishing the job. This is the most ridiculous thing I’ve ever heard. He doesn’t even bite back when other dogs in the dog park bite his hair. The groomer also claimed that my dog wouldn’t stop barking. But when I got there to pick him up I stood outside for a few minutes and didn’t even hear him whine. He only started barking when he heard me talking. I know my dog isn’t the most cooperative dog to groom because he doesn’t like to stand for a long time and would always tries to sit down. But saying that he bites people is a very serious accusation that I have never heard from any of his previous groomers. If this groomer doesn’t know how to calm a nervous dog she should reconsider her profession. One other thing I noticed is that they told me my dog needs 2-3 hours to groom but their next client is scheduled just 1 hours after me. When I went to pick up my dog, the groomer was still working on the dog before mine. So my assumption is that she just wants to skip a not so easy dog since her schedule is so packed. Extremely unprofessional. Absolutely do not recommend.
